alert.note: Alert for Eastern Highland; Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 3:00PM EST until January 09 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulation ranging from 1 to 3 inches above 2,000 feet to a coating to one inch below 2,000 feet. Ice accumulations ranging from a trace to a tenth of an inch for most areas above 1,000 feet with localized amounts around one to two tenths of an inch above 2,000 feet. Southeast winds gusting around 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland and Eastern Highland Counties. In West Virginia, Western Grant, Western Pendleton and Eastern Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 1 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as a wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain before changing to all rain by early Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
